ğŸ“Š Data Stories

Overview

The ability to analyze data is a crucial skill, enabling individuals to draw meaningful conclusions and make informed decisions. By enhancing your ability to uncover trends and patterns, you are also developing insights that drive innovation to address real-world problems.

ğŸ“‹ Event Details

  • 2 members from each team will compete in this event.
  • At the start of the competition, teams will be given a packet of key figures and data related to this yearâ€™s theme.
  • Teams will have 30 minutes to analyze the source material and develop a 5-minute (maximum) presentation.
  • In their presentations, teams must:
    • Interpret key figures from the dataset and communicate their analysis to a panel of judges.
    • Identify one major challenge.
    • Propose one feasible solution that is grounded in the data or figures and relevant to the challenge area.

ğŸ† Evaluation Criteria

Your presentations will be evaluated based on the following categories:

1ï¸âƒ£ Data Interpretation

ğŸ”¹ Interpretation of Data: Does the team effectively analyze the provided figures and data and extract meaningful insights?
ğŸ”¹ Analysis of Trends & Patterns: Are key trends, patterns, and correlations accurately identified and clearly explained?

2ï¸âƒ£ Problem Identification

ğŸ”¹ Relevance: Is the problem well-defined, specific, and relevant to the theme area? ğŸ”¹ Connection to Data: Is the problem clearly derived from the data and figures, demonstrating a strong connection between analysis and challenge?

3ï¸âƒ£ Solution Proposal

ğŸ”¹ Feasibility: How practical and innovative is the proposed solution to address the identified problem?
ğŸ”¹ Implications: Does the solution demonstrate a thoughtful understanding of the data and challenge while considering ethical, accessibility, or implementation concerns?

4ï¸âƒ£ Communication & Creativity

ğŸ”¹ How well does the team communicate their findings and ideas within the 5-minute presentation?
ğŸ”¹ Is the presentation engaging, structured, and easy to follow?

ğŸ“ Additional Notes

  • Creativity and storytelling are encouragedâ€”data is most impactful when presented clearly and persuasively.
  • Presentations should not exceed 5 minutesâ€”teams will be cut off if they exceed the time limit.
  • Judges will consider how well teams integrate data-driven insights into their problem and solution.

Good luck, and may the best storytellers win! ğŸš€ğŸ¤ğŸ“Š

2025: ğŸ… Are You Ready to Tell the Story of AI in Education?

Your challenge is to transform figures and data into meaningful insights and propose a data-driven solution to one of educationâ€™s biggest questions:

How can AI improve learning while ensuring fairness, accessibility, and effectiveness?

Theme: Use of AI in Education ğŸ“ˆğŸ“‰ğŸ“Š

Resources

ğŸ” Key Considerations for AI in Education

As you analyze the dataset, think about:
âœ… Equity & Access: Who benefits from AI in education, and who might be left behind?
âœ… Bias & Ethics: How do AI algorithms influence learning opportunities and fairness?
âœ… Personalization: How can AI improve individualized learning experiences?
âœ… Teacher Support: How can AI assist (rather than replace) educators?
âœ… Data Privacy: What safeguards should be in place when AI collects student data?

Use the data to support your arguments and make a compelling case for your proposed solution!

Final figures and references, will be linked here after the 2025 competition held in March 2025.

How can we make science more accessible, engaging, and relevant to our communities?

ğŸ” Key Considerations for Science and Technology Literacy

As you analyze the dataset, think about:
âœ… Equity & Access: Who has access to quality science education, and who might be left behind?
âœ… Public Engagement: How can we make scientific information easier to understand for different audiences?
âœ… Technology & Innovation: How do new technologies enhance or hinder science literacy?
âœ… STEM Careers: How can we inspire more students to pursue careers in science and technology?
